Note Name: Blackout periods or restricted scheduling windows
Description: "Specified times of the year (e.g., year-end close) when no training may be scheduled.,"
"Procedures for handling seat limits and automated waitlist processing.,"
"Policy on learner/manager notice required to avoid penalties or "no-show" fees.,"

Note Name: Facility reservation and room setup lead times
Description: "Operational window required to book and prep a physical training space.,"
"Standard timelines for printing and shipping physical materials to global sites.,"

Note Name: Facilitation guide and script adherence requirements
Description: "Guidelines defining the degree to which instructors must stick to the script vs. adaptive delivery."

Note Name: Training timing and pacing adherence expectations
Description: "Rules for session duration management and ensuring learning objectives are met within scheduled windows."
"Authority levels required for a trainer to modify standard materials for a specific audience."
"Mandated or recommended methods for maintaining participant focus and interaction."

Note Name: Question handling and parking lot procedures
Description: "Protocols for managing in-class inquiries, including "parking lots" for out-of-scope topics."
"Standards for establishing classroom norms and expectations at the start of training."
"Specific procedures for managing disruptive or uncooperative learners."

Note Name: Energy management and break timing flexibility
Description: "Guidelines for managing session flow and adjusting break times to maintain learner alertness."
"Policies defining how two or more instructors split teaching, logistics, and monitoring tasks."
"Procedures for smooth transitions between different facilitators during multi-day or modular programs."

Note Name: Preparation and coordination requirements for teams
Description: "Rules for instructor collaboration before a team-taught session begins."
"Mandate for co-facilitators to review performance and share insights after session completion."

Note Name: Guest speaker invitation and approval processes
Description: "Formal workflow for vetting and authorizing external or subject-matter guest lecturers."

Note Name: Briefing and preparation requirements for guests
Description: "Requirement to prepare guest speakers on organizational norms, tech, and audience expectations."

Note Name: Guest presentation content review and approval
Description: "Policy requiring organizational sign-off on any materials brought in by external SMEs."
"Defined compensation or gift limits for guest contributors."
"Mandate for external speakers to sign NDAs before accessing internal training environments."

Note Name: Promotional material and contact sharing policies
Description: "Rules regarding when guest speakers can share their own marketing or contact info."

Note Name: Technical support availability and response SLAs
Description: "Defined SLAs for IT or LMS help desk response during active training."
"Policies regarding the provision of supplemental 1-on-1 support for struggling learners."
"Standard procedures for learners to request and receive legally mandated training adjustments."
"Rules for providing translators or localized materials for non-native speaking participants."
"Facilities and scheduling policies supporting parents attending training."
"Guidelines for accommodating prayer times or holy days during scheduled training."
"Specific design or facilitation adjustments for learners with ADHD, Autism, etc."
"Percentage of seat time required to earn completion credit or certification."
"Defined thresholds for late arrival or early exit that disqualify a learner from credit."
"Standards for evaluating the depth and relevance of learner contributions in class."
"Rules regarding the use of webcams during virtual instructor-led training (VILT)."
"Organizational stance on learners performing non-training work during sessions."
"Restrictions on mobile phone or laptop use during live instruction."
"Consent and notification rules for capturing video or audio of live training."
"Restrictions on sharing training content or session details on public platforms."
"General expectations for learner conduct and interpersonal interaction."
"Mandated reporting and zero-tolerance rules for training-related misconduct."
"Policy requiring an environment where learners feel safe to take risks and fail."
"Rules preventing learners from sharing sensitive information discussed in peer activities."
"Organizational preference for learner interaction models (e.g., leaderboards vs. teaming)."
"Standards for how learners should give and receive constructive peer or instructor critique."
"Organizational priorities regarding check-ins during learning vs. final tests."
"Policy choice between testing against standards vs. testing against peer averages."
"Rules for awarding credit based on proven skill vs. hours spent in seat."
"Defined cut-scores or performance levels required to progress in a curriculum."

Note Name: Assessment for learning vs. assessment of learning
Description: "Emphasis on using tests as instructional tools rather than just for grading."

Note Name: Growth mindset and learning from failure
Description: "Policies encouraging remediation and learning from failed assessment attempts."
"Mandate to document the mapping of test items to specific learning objectives."
"Requirement for every assessment task to directly measure a stated learning goal."
"Standards for the difficulty (p-value) and discrimination (D-value) of test questions."
"Requirement to use varied item types (MC, essay, sim) to improve assessment validity."
"Standards for writing plausible but incorrect choices in multiple-choice questions."

Note Name: Item bank development and maintenance standards
Description: "Procedures for updating, tagging, and retiring assessment questions over time."

Note Name: Pilot testing requirements for new items
Description: "Mandate to verify new questions with a sample group before high-stakes use."
"Rules for rotating questions to prevent cheating and maintain test integrity."
"Technical standards for ensuring different versions of a test are equivalent in difficulty."
"Physical or digital standards for where and how assessments are conducted."

Note Name: Assessment time limits and extension policies
Description: "Policies governing the duration of tests and the criteria for granting extensions."
"Rules regarding learner access to manuals or notes during an assessment."

Note Name: Reference material and job aid access
Description: "Policy on allowing learners to use the same tools they would have on the job during testing."
"Specific limits on peer-to-peer interaction during an assessment."

Note Name: Calculator and software tool usage permissions
Description: "Authorized use of calculators, software, or specific devices during a test."
"Rules for providing extra time or translated dictionaries for non-native speakers."

Note Name: Identity verification methods for remote testing
Description: "Methods for confirming the person taking the test is the intended learner (remote)."
"Mandate to use software that prevents opening other windows during online testing."
"Standards for the lighting and privacy of a learner's remote testing space."
"Policy choosing between live human oversight vs. AI-monitored testing."
"Requirement to obtain learner agreement before using proctoring recordings."
"Procedures for testing a learner's device and connection before an online exam begins."

Note Name: Incident response for technical exam failures
Description: "Protocols for handling tech failures or disconnects during a timed assessment."
"Standard workflow for verifying credentials before an in-person exam."
"List of objects (phones, bags) not allowed in the physical testing center."
"Rules regarding the use and destruction of scratch paper in an exam room."
"Defined procedures for learners needing to leave the room during a timed test."
"Physical security measures (seating gaps, monitoring) for in-person exams."
"Standards for the personnel responsible for overseeing physical testing."

Note Name: Passing score and cut-score setting methodologies
Description: "Methodologies (e.g., Angoff) for determining the minimum passing grade."
"Definitions of what constitutes "Basic," "Proficient," or "Expert" scores."

Note Name: Partial credit and multi-step scoring policies
Description: "Policies regarding awarding points for partially correct multi-step answers."
"Rules for how various assessments (tests, labs, projects) combine for a final grade."
"Defined mathematical models for calculating overall course performance."
"Standards for handling decimal scores and borderline passing cases."
"Formal process for learners to challenge an assessment result or final grade."
"Specific circumstances under which an automated grade is reviewed by a human."

Note Name: Retake attempt limits and waiting periods
Description: "Rules defining the maximum number of attempts and mandatory wait times between them."

Note Name: Retake fee and cost recovery policies
Description: "Policies regarding the cost of additional assessment attempts."

Note Name: Alternate form usage requirements for retakes
Description: "Requirement to use a different set of questions for a learner's second attempt."

Note Name: Remediation and study mandates before retake
Description: "Policy requiring specific study or coaching before a retake is allowed."

Note Name: Score reporting logic for multiple attempts
Description: "Rule on whether the highest, most recent, or average score is recorded."
"Procedures for scheduling and administering a second assessment attempt."
"Defined organizational impact of failing a mandatory training after all retakes."
"Clear examples of what constitutes cheating or plagiarism in L&D."
"Policy on using plagiarism checkers or data forensics to identify dishonesty."
"Procedural steps for reviewing a suspected violation of academic integrity."

Note Name: Learner due process and appeal rights
Description: "Rights of the learner to respond to allegations and appeal misconduct decisions."
"Range of penalties for academic dishonesty, from course failure to termination."
"Mandate to record and archive all evidence of training-related misconduct."

Note Name: Statistical pattern analysis for unusual results
Description: "Use of statistical tools to identify unusual answer clusters or timing."

Note Name: Score reporting format and detail standards
Description: "Standardized layout for learner score reports and achievement notifications."

Note Name: Timing and release requirements for results
Description: "Target SLAs for how quickly scores must be released to learners."
"Requirement to show learners specific areas of strength and weakness after a test."
"Policy choice between showing overall score vs. specific question feedback."

Note Name: Correct answer revelation and review policies
Description: "Rules for when and if the correct answers are shown to learners after a test."
"Policy regarding showing learners their percentile rank or group averages."
"Authorized channels (LMS, secure email) for transmitting results."
"Oversight body responsible for authorizing and auditing internal certification tracks."
"Prerequisites (tenure, role, current score) required to enter a certification program."
"Hard timelines for how long an internal credential remains active (e.g., 2 years)."
"Required ongoing activities (PDHs, labs) needed to keep a certificate current."
"Rules for the full re-testing or re-evaluation process upon credential expiration."
"Defined conditions (e.g., policy breach) under which a credential is removed."
"Laddering rules for moving from associate to professional internal tiers."
"Policies for creating "add-on" or niche certifications for specific job tasks."
"Organizational stance on paying for or recognizing outside certs (PMP, CPA)."
"Curated list of 3rd-party credentials the organization officially accepts."
"Financial policies for covering the cost of external exam fees."

Note Name: Study leave and exam preparation time
Description: "Allowance of paid work time for employees preparing for high-stakes external exams."
"Rules requiring a passing score before the company pays for an exam."

Note Name: CEU tracking and documentation from outside sources
Description: "System of record and process for documenting continuing education units from outside sources."
"Rules for converting internal training attendance into professional development hours."

Note Name: Digital badge framework and platform selection
Description: "Definition of the technology and standards (e.g., Open Badges) used for digital icons."

Note Name: Badge design and required metadata standards
Description: "Required data fields (issuer, criteria, evidence) baked into a digital badge."

Note Name: Issuance criteria and approval processes for badges
Description: "Approval chain required before a badge is sent to a learner."
"Logic defining how small "milestone" badges combine into larger credentials."

Note Name: Badge display and external sharing guidelines
Description: "Rules for learners posting badges on LinkedIn or other professional sites."
"Technical mechanism for 3rd parties to validate the authenticity of a badge."
"Rules for automatic badge retirement or renewal notifications."

Note Name: Profile and HR system integration for badges
Description: "Procedures for syncing internal digital badges with employee HR profiles."
"Standards for the visual look, paper quality, or digital layout of diplomas."
"Anti-fraud features such as QR codes, digital signatures, or embossed seals."
"Mandated data points (name, date, signature) that must appear on every credential."
"Policy designating which format is the "official" version of an award."
"Unique identification system for tracking every certificate issued."
"Designated leaders permitted to sign organizational credentials."
"Procedures and costs for re-issuing a lost or damaged original diploma."
"Policies regarding the issuance of training credit after a learner's passing."
"Standards for graduation events, guest lists, and formal recognition."

Note Name: Honor rolls and high achievement recognition
Description: "Criteria and publication rules for top-performing training cohorts."
"Policies governing prizes or scholarships granted for exceptional performance."
"Rules for announcing training achievements on internal news sites or walls."
"Guidelines for manager-led "shout-outs" regarding direct report learning."

Note Name: Wall of fame and physical recognition displays
Description: "Physical or digital displays showcasing long-term training milestones."
"Standardized layout for the complete history of an employee's training."
"Formal process for employees or departments to obtain a copy of learning records."
"Rules regarding the cost of producing official paper or verified digital records."
"Policy allowing choice between summary records and detailed itemized histories."
"Protocols for sending internal transcripts to outside schools or employers."
"Conditions (e.g., equipment debt) under which transcript access is restricted."
"Rule on whether failed or incomplete attempts are visible on the permanent record."

Note Name: Historical record correction and audit processes
Description: "Formal audit process for fixing errors in a learner's training history."

Note Name: Training record retention schedules by type
Description: "Table defining the legal and operational lifespan of different training documents."

Note Name: Individual learner access and portal rights
Description: "Rights and portal requirements for learners to view their own training files."

Note Name: Manager visibility and record access limits
Description: "Defined visibility limits for supervisors looking at their team's records."

Note Name: HR system record integration and system of record
Description: "Rules for mapping LMS completion data into the primary personnel database."
"Procedures for transferring training files when an employee moves between units."

Note Name: Alumni and separated personnel record access
Description: "Policies for former employees to access their training records post-employment."
"Requirement to log every view or modification of a training record."

Note Name: Assessment data usage for program improvement
Description: "Mandate to use assessment stats to identify and fix course design flaws."

Note Name: Performance data usage in personnel decisions
Description: "Rules regarding when training scores can be used for hiring or firing decisions."

Note Name: Early warning predictive analytics for at-risk learners
Description: "Use of analytics to flag learners at risk of failure before they complete a course."
"Permissions for viewing group trends without exposing individual identities."

Note Name: Data de-identification for research and analysis
Description: "Standards for stripping PII from training data used for broad research."

Note Name: Linking training data to business outcome KPIs
Description: "Mandate to correlate training metrics with actual operational KPIs (e.g., sales)."
"Standardized structures for all formal instructional project files."
